name: items
description: Build an item list of main links to show in the admin navigation.

name: buildSettingComponent
description:
buildSettingComponent takes a settings object and turns it into a component.
Depending on the type of input, you can set the type to 'bool', 'select', or
any standard <input> type. Any values inside the 'extra' object will be added
to the component as an attribute.

Alternatively, you can pass a callback that will be executed in ExtensionPage's
context to include custom JSX elements.

name: homePageItems
description:
Build a list of options for the default homepage. Each option must be an
object with `path` and `label` properties.

name: className
description: Get the class name to apply to the widget.

name: content
description: Get the content of the widget.

name: EditGroupModal
description:
The `EditGroupModal` component shows a modal dialog which allows the user
to create or edit a group.

types: {"discuss": string, "documentation": string, "support": string, "website": string, "donate": string, "source": string}

name: HeaderPrimary
description:
The `HeaderPrimary` component displays primary header controls. On the
default skin, these are shown just to the right of the forum title.

name: items
description: Build an item list for the controls.

name: HeaderSecondary
description: The `HeaderSecondary` component displays secondary header controls.

name: items
description: Build an item list for the controls.

name: SessionDropdown
description:
The `SessionDropdown` component shows a button with the current user's
avatar/name, with a dropdown of session controls.

name: items
description: Build an item list for the contents of the dropdown menu.

name: upload
description: Prompt the user to upload an image.

name: remove
description: Remove the logo.

name: success
description: After a successful upload/removal, reload the page.

name: failure
description: If upload/removal fails, stop loading.

name: ExtensionPageResolver
description:
A custom route resolver for ExtensionPage that generates handles routes
to default extension pages or a page provided by an extension.

name: routes
description: The `routes` initializer defines the forum app's routes.

name: for
description: This function simply takes the extension id

name: registerSetting
description:
This function registers your settings with Flarum

It takes either a settings object or a callback.

name: registerPermission
description: This function registers your permission with Flarum

name: registerPage
description:
Replace the default extension page with a custom component.
This component would typically extend ExtensionPage

name: getSettings
description: Get an extension's registered settings

name: getAllExtensionPermissions
description: Get an ItemList of all extensions' registered permissions

name: getExtensionPermissions
description: Get a singular extension's registered permissions

name: extensionHasPermissions
description: Checks whether a given extension has registered permissions.

name: getPage
description: Returns an extension's custom page component if it exists.

name: Application
description:
The `App` class provides a container for an application, as well as various
utilities for the rest of the app to use.

name: forum
description: The forum model for this application.

name: routes
description:
A map of routes, keyed by a unique route name. Each route is an object
containing the following properties:

- `path` The path that the route is accessed at.
- `component` The Mithril component to render when this route is active.

name: initializers
description: An ordered list of initializers to bootstrap the application.

name: session
description: The app's session.

name: translator
description: The app's translator.

name: store
description: The app's data store.

name: cache
description:
A local cache that can be used to store data at the application level, so
that is persists between different routes.

name: booted
description: Whether or not the app has been booted.

name: requestErrorAlert
description:
The key for an Alert that was shown as a result of an AJAX request error.
If present, it will be dismissed on the next successful request.

name: current
description:
The page the app is currently on.

This object holds information about the type of page we are currently
visiting, and sometimes additional arbitrary page state that may be
relevant to lower-level components.

name: previous
description:
The page the app was on before the current page.

Once the application navigates to another page, the object previously
assigned to this.current will be moved to this.previous, while this.current
is re-initialized.

name: alerts
description: An object that manages the state of active alerts.

name: preloadedApiDocument
description: Get the API response document that has been preloaded into the application.

name: screen
description: Determine the current screen mode, based on our media queries.

name: setTitle
description: Set the <title> of the page.

name: setTitleCount
description: Set a number to display in the <title> of the page.

name: request
description: Make an AJAX request, handling any low-level errors that may occur.

name: route
description: Construct a URL to the route with the given name.

name: Component
description:
The `Component` class defines a user interface 'building block'. A component
generates a virtual DOM to be rendered on each redraw.

Essentially, this is a wrapper for Mithril's components that adds several useful features:

- In the `oninit` and `onbeforeupdate` lifecycle hooks, we store vnode attrs in `this.attrs.
This allows us to use attrs across components without having to pass the vnode to every single
method.
- The static `initAttrs` method allows a convenient way to provide defaults (or to otherwise modify)
the attrs that have been passed into a component.
- When the component is created in the DOM, we store its DOM element under `this.element`; this lets
us use jQuery to modify child DOM state from internal methods via the `this.$()` method.
- A convenience `component` method, which serves as an alternative to hyperscript and JSX.

As with other Mithril components, components extending Component can be initialized
and nested using JSX, hyperscript, or a combination of both. The `component` method can also
be used.

Returns a jQuery object for this component's element. If you pass in a
selector string, this method will return a jQuery object, using the current
element as its buffer.

For example, calling `component.$('li')` will return a jQuery object
containing all of the `li` elements inside the DOM element of this
component.

name: component
description:
Convenience method to attach a component without JSX.
Has the same effect as calling `m(THIS_CLASS, attrs, children)`.

name: setAttrs
description:
Saves a reference to the vnode attrs after running them through initAttrs,
and checking for common issues.

name: initAttrs
description:
Initialize the component's attrs.

This can be used to assign default values for missing, optional attrs.

name: Fragment
description:
The `Fragment` class represents a chunk of DOM that is rendered once with Mithril and then takes
over control of its own DOM and lifecycle.

This is very similar to the `Component` wrapper class, but is used for more fine-grained control over
the rendering and display of some significant chunks of the DOM. In contrast to components, fragments
do not offer Mithril's lifecycle hooks.

Use this when you want to enjoy the benefits of JSX / VDOM for initial rendering, combined with
small helper methods that then make updates to that DOM directly, instead of fully redrawing
everything through Mithril.

This should only be used when necessary, and only with `m.render`. If you are unsure whether you need
this or `Component, you probably need `Component`.

Returns a jQuery object for this fragment's element. If you pass in a
selector string, this method will return a jQuery object, using the current
element as its buffer.

For example, calling `fragment.$('li')` will return a jQuery object
containing all of the `li` elements inside the DOM element of this
fragment.

name: render
description:
Get the renderable virtual DOM that represents the fragment's view.

This should NOT be overridden by subclasses. Subclasses wishing to define
their virtual DOM should override Fragment#view instead.

name: Model
description:
The `Model` class represents a local data resource. It provides methods to
persist changes via the API.

params.name: data
params.description: A resource object from the API.

params.name: store
params.description: The data store that this model should be persisted to.

name: data
description: The resource object from the API.

name: freshness
description:
The time at which the model's data was last updated. Watching the value
of this property is a fast way to retain/cache a subtree if data hasn't
changed.

name: exists
description: Whether or not the resource exists on the server.

name: store
description: The data store that this resource should be persisted to.

name: id
description: Get the model's ID.

name: attribute
description: Get one of the model's attributes.

name: pushData
description: Merge new data into this model locally.

params.name: data
params.description: A resource object to merge into this model

name: pushAttributes
description: Merge new attributes into this model locally.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The attributes to merge.

name: save
description: Merge new attributes into this model, both locally and with persistence.

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attributes to save. If a 'relationships' key
    exists, it will be extracted and relationships will also be saved.

name: delete
description: Send a request to delete the resource.

params.name: body
params.description: Data to send along with the DELETE request.

name: apiEndpoint
description: Construct a path to the API endpoint for this resource.

name: attribute
description: Generate a function which returns the value of the given attribute.

params.name: transform
params.description: A function to transform the attribute value

name: hasOne
description:
Generate a function which returns the value of the given has-one
relationship.

return.description:
false if no information about the
    relationship exists; undefined if the relationship exists but the model
    has not been loaded; or the model if it has been loaded.

name: hasMany
description:
Generate a function which returns the value of the given has-many
relationship.

return.description:
false if no information about the relationship
    exists; an array if it does, containing models if they have been
    loaded, and undefined for those that have not.

name: transformDate
description: Transform the given value into a Date object.

name: getIdentifier
description: Get a resource identifier object for the given model.

name: Session
description:
The `Session` class defines the current user session. It stores a reference
to the current authenticated user, and provides methods to log in/out.

name: user
description: The current authenticated user.

name: csrfToken
description: The CSRF token.

name: login
description: Attempt to log in a user.

params.name: identification
params.description: The username/email.

name: logout
description: Log the user out.

name: Store
description:
The `Store` class defines a local data store, and provides methods to
retrieve data from the API.

name: data
description:
The local data store. A tree of resource types to IDs, such that
accessing data[type][id] will return the model for that type/ID.

name: models
description:
The model registry. A map of resource types to the model class that
should be used to represent resources of that type.

name: pushPayload
description: Push resources contained within an API payload into the store.

return.description:
The model(s) representing the resource(s) contained
    within the 'data' key of the payload.

name: pushObject
description:
Create a model to represent a resource object (or update an existing one),
and push it into the store.

params.name: data
params.description: The resource object

return.description:
The model, or null if no model class has been
    registered for this resource type.

name: find
description: Make a request to the API to find record(s) of a specific type.

params.name: type
params.description: The resource type.

params.name: id
params.description:
The ID(s) of the model(s) to retrieve.
    Alternatively, if an object is passed, it will be handled as the
    `query` parameter.

name: getById
description: Get a record from the store by ID.

params.name: type
params.description: The resource type.

params.name: id
params.description: The resource ID.

name: getBy
description: Get a record from the store by the value of a model attribute.

params.name: type
params.description: The resource type.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the method on the model.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the model attribute.

name: all
description: Get all loaded records of a specific type.

name: remove
description: Remove the given model from the store.

name: createRecord
description: Create a new record of the given type.

params.name: type
params.description: The resource type

params.name: data
params.description: Any data to initialize the model with

name: AlertManager
description:
The `AlertManager` component provides an area in which `Alert` components can
be shown and dismissed.

name: Badge
description:
The `Badge` component represents a user/discussion badge, indicating some
status (e.g. a discussion is stickied, a user is an admin).

A badge may have the following special attrs:

- `type` The type of badge this is. This will be used to give the badge a
  class name of `Badge--{type}`.
- `icon` The name of an icon to show inside the badge.
- `label`

All other attrs will be assigned as attributes on the badge element.

name: Button
description:
The `Button` component defines an element which, when clicked, performs an
action.

### Attrs

- `icon` The name of the icon class. If specified, the button will be given a
  'has-icon' class name.
- `disabled` Whether or not the button is disabled. If truthy, the button
  will be given a 'disabled' class name, and any `onclick` handler will be
  removed.
- `loading` Whether or not the button should be in a disabled loading state.

All other attrs will be assigned as attributes on the button element.

Note that a Button has no default class names. This is because a Button can
be used to represent any generic clickable control, like a menu item.

name: getButtonContent
description: Get the template for the button's content.

name: Checkbox
description:
The `Checkbox` component defines a checkbox input.

### Attrs

- `state` Whether or not the checkbox is checked.
- `className` The class name for the root element.
- `disabled` Whether or not the checkbox is disabled.
- `loading` Whether or not the checkbox is loading.
- `onchange` A callback to run when the checkbox is checked/unchecked.
- `children` A text label to display next to the checkbox.

name: getDisplay
description: Get the template for the checkbox's display (tick/cross icon).

name: onchange
description: Run a callback when the state of the checkbox is changed.

name: ConfirmDocumentUnload
description:
The `ConfirmDocumentUnload` component can be used to register a global
event handler that prevents closing the browser window/tab based on the
return value of a given callback prop.

### Attrs

- `when` - a callback returning true when the browser should prompt for
           confirmation before closing the window/tab

### Children

NOTE: Only the first child will be rendered. (Use this component to wrap
another component / DOM element.)

name: Dropdown
description:
The `Dropdown` component displays a button which, when clicked, shows a
dropdown menu beneath it.

### Attrs

- `buttonClassName` A class name to apply to the dropdown toggle button.
- `menuClassName` A class name to apply to the dropdown menu.
- `icon` The name of an icon to show in the dropdown toggle button.
- `caretIcon` The name of an icon to show on the right of the button.
- `label` The label of the dropdown toggle button. Defaults to 'Controls'.
- `accessibleToggleLabel` The label used to describe the dropdown toggle button to assistive readers. Defaults to 'Toggle dropdown menu'.
- `onhide`
- `onshow`

The children will be displayed as a list inside of the dropdown menu.

name: getButton
description: Get the template for the button.

name: getButtonContent
description: Get the template for the button's content.

name: EditUserModal
description: The `EditUserModal` component displays a modal dialog with a login form.

name: FieldSet
description:
The `FieldSet` component defines a collection of fields, displayed in a list
underneath a title. Accepted properties are:

- `className` The class name for the fieldset.
- `label` The title of this group of fields.

The children should be an array of items to show in the fieldset.

name: Link
description:
The link component enables both internal and external links.
It will return a regular HTML link for any links to external sites,
and it will use Mithril's m.route.Link for any internal links.

Links will default to internal; the 'external' attr must be set to
`true` for the link to be external.

name: LinkButton
description:
The `LinkButton` component defines a `Button` which links to a route.

### Attrs

All of the attrs accepted by `Button`, plus:

- `active` Whether or not the page that this button links to is currently
  active.
- `href` The URL to link to. If the current URL `m.route()` matches this,
  the `active` prop will automatically be set to true.
- `force` Whether the page should be fully rerendered. Defaults to `true`.

name: isActive
description: Determine whether a component with the given attrs is 'active'.

name: Modal
description:
The `Modal` component displays a modal dialog, wrapped in a form. Subclasses
should implement the `className`, `title`, and `content` methods.

name: isDismissible
description: Determine whether or not the modal should be dismissible via an 'x' button.

name: alertAttrs
description: Attributes for an alert component to show below the header.

name: className
description: Get the class name to apply to the modal.

name: title
description: Get the title of the modal dialog.

name: content
description: Get the content of the modal.

name: onsubmit
description: Handle the modal form's submit event.

name: onready
description: Focus on the first input when the modal is ready to be used.

name: hide
description: Hide the modal.

name: loaded
description: Stop loading.

name: onerror
description:
Show an alert describing an error returned from the API, and give focus to
the first relevant field.

name: ModalManager
description:
The `ModalManager` component manages a modal dialog. Only one modal dialog
can be shown at once; loading a new component into the ModalManager will
overwrite the previous one.

name: Navigation
description:
The `Navigation` component displays a set of navigation buttons. Typically
this is just a back button which pops the app's History. If the user is on
the root page and there is no history to pop, then in some instances it may
show a button that toggles the app's drawer.

If the app has a pane, it will also include a 'pin' button which toggles the
pinned state of the pane.

Accepts the following attrs:

- `className` The name of a class to set on the root element.
- `drawer` Whether or not to show a button to toggle the app's drawer if
  there is no more history to pop.

name: getBackButton
description: Get the back button.

name: getPaneButton
description: Get the pane pinned toggle button.

name: getDrawerButton
description: Get the drawer toggle button.

name: Page
description: The `Page` component

name: bodyClass
description: A class name to apply to the body while the route is active.

name: scrollTopOnCreate
description: Whether we should scroll to the top of the page when its rendered.

name: useBrowserScrollRestoration
description: Whether the browser should restore scroll state on refreshes.

name: Placeholder
description:
The `Placeholder` component displays a muted text with some call to action,
usually used as an empty state.

### Attrs

- `text`

name: Select
description:
The `Select` component displays a <select> input, surrounded with some extra
elements for styling. It accepts the following attrs:

- `options` A map of option values to labels.
- `onchange` A callback to run when the selected value is changed.
- `value` The value of the selected option.
- `disabled` Disabled state for the input.
- `wrapperAttrs` A map of attrs to be passed to the DOM element wrapping the `<select>`

Other attributes are passed directly to the `<select>` element rendered to the DOM.

name: isActive
description:
Determines via a vnode is currently "active".
Due to changes in Mithril 2, attrs will not be instantiated until AFTER view()
is initially called on the parent component, so we can not always depend on the
active attr to determine which element should be displayed as the "active child".

This is a temporary patch, and as so, is not exported / placed in utils.

name: SelectDropdown
description:
The `SelectDropdown` component is the same as a `Dropdown`, except the toggle
button's label is set as the label of the first child which has a truthy
`active` prop.

### Attrs

- `caretIcon`
- `defaultLabel`

name: Separator
description: The `Separator` component defines a menu separator item.

name: SplitDropdown
description:
The `SplitDropdown` component is similar to `Dropdown`, but the first child
is displayed as its own button prior to the toggle button.

name: getFirstChild
description:
Get the first child. If the first child is an array, the first item in that
array will be returned.

name: Switch
description:
The `Switch` component is a `Checkbox`, but with a switch display instead of
a tick/cross one.

name: TextEditor
description:
The `TextEditor` component displays a textarea with controls, including a
submit button.

### Attrs

- `composer`
- `submitLabel`
- `value`
- `placeholder`
- `disabled`
- `preview`

name: value
description: The value of the editor.

name: disabled
description: Whether the editor is disabled.

name: controlItems
description: Build an item list for the text editor controls.

name: toolbarItems
description: Build an item list for the toolbar controls.

name: oninput
description: Handle input into the textarea.

name: onsubmit
description: Handle the submit button being clicked.

name: TextEditorButton
description:
The `TextEditorButton` component displays a button suitable for the text
editor toolbar.

name: extend
description:
Extend an object's method by running its output through a mutating callback
every time it is called.

The callback accepts the method's return value and should perform any
mutations directly on this value. For this reason, this function will not be
effective on methods which return scalar values (numbers, strings, booleans).

Care should be taken to extend the correct object – in most cases, a class'
prototype will be the desired target of extension, not the class itself.
examples:
<caption>Example usage of extending one method.</caption>
extend(Discussion.prototype, 'badges', function(badges) {
  // do something with `badges`
});

<caption>Example usage of extending multiple methods.</caption>
extend(IndexPage.prototype, ['oncreate', 'onupdate'], function(vnode) {
  // something that needs to be run on creation and update
});

params.name: object
params.description: The object that owns the method

params.name: methods
params.description: The name or names of the method(s) to extend

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback which mutates the method's output

name: override
description:
Override an object's method by replacing it with a new function, so that the
new function will be run every time the object's method is called.

The replacement function accepts the original method as its first argument,
which is like a call to `super`. Any arguments passed to the original method
are also passed to the replacement.

Care should be taken to extend the correct object – in most cases, a class'
prototype will be the desired target of extension, not the class itself.
examples:
<caption>Example usage of overriding one method.</caption>
override(Discussion.prototype, 'badges', function(original) {
  const badges = original();
  // do something with badges
  return badges;
});

<caption>Example usage of overriding multiple methods.</caption>
extend(Discussion.prototype, ['oncreate', 'onupdate'], function(original, vnode) {
  // something that needs to be run on creation and update
});

params.name: object
params.description: The object that owns the method

params.name: method
params.description: The name or names of the method(s) to override

params.name: newMethod
params.description: The method to replace it with

name: punctuateSeries
description:
The `punctuateSeries` helper formats a list of strings (e.g. names) to read
fluently in the application's locale.

```js
punctuateSeries(['Toby', 'Franz', 'Dominion']) // Toby, Franz, and Dominion
```

name: DefaultResolver
description:
Generates a route resolver for a given component.
In addition to regular route resolver functionality:
- It provide the current route name as an attr
- It sets a key on the component so a rerender will be triggered on route change.

name: makeKey
description:
When a route change results in a changed key, a full page
rerender occurs. This method can be overriden in subclasses
to prevent rerenders on some route changes.

name: dismiss
description: Dismiss an alert.

name: clear
description: Clear all alerts.

name: show
description: Show a modal dialog.

name: close
description: Close the modal dialog.

name: matches
description: Determine whether the page matches the given class and data.

params.name: type
params.description:
The page class to check against. Subclasses are
                     accepted as well.

name: disabled
description: Set the disabled status of the editor.

name: focus
description: Focus on the editor.

name: destroy
description: Destroy the editor

name: Drawer
description:
The `Drawer` class controls the page's drawer. The drawer is the area the
slides out from the left on mobile devices; it contains the header and the
footer.

name: isOpen
description: Check whether or not the drawer is currently open.

name: hide
description: Hide the drawer.

name: show
description: Show the drawer.

name: ItemList
description:
The `ItemList` class collects items and then arranges them into an array
by priority.

name: items
description: The items in the list

name: isEmpty
description: Check whether the list is empty.

name: has
description: Check whether an item is present in the list.

name: get
description: Get the content of an item.

name: add
description: Add an item to the list.

name: replace
description: Replace an item in the list, only if it is already present.

name: remove
description: Remove an item from the list.

name: merge
description: Merge another list's items into this one.

name: toArray
description:
Convert the list into an array of item content arranged by priority. Each
item's content will be assigned an `itemName` property equal to the item's
unique key.

name: ScrollListener
description:
The `ScrollListener` class sets up a listener that handles window scroll
events.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The callback to run when the scroll position
    changes.

name: loop
description:
On each animation frame, as long as the listener is active, run the
`update` method.

name: update
description: Run the callback, whether there was a scroll event or not.

name: start
description: Start listening to and handling the window's scroll position.

name: stop
description: Stop listening to and handling the window's scroll position.

name: SubtreeRetainer
description:
The `SubtreeRetainer` class keeps track of a number of pieces of data,
comparing the values of these pieces at every iteration.

This is useful for preventing redraws to relatively static (or huge)
components whose VDOM only depends on very few values, when none of them
have changed.

params.name: callbacks
params.description: Functions returning data to keep track of.

name: needsRebuild
description:
Return whether any data has changed since the last check.
If so, Mithril needs to re-diff the vnode and its children.

name: check
description: Add another callback to be checked.

name: invalidate
description: Invalidate the subtree, forcing it to be rerendered.

name: abbreviateNumber
description: The `abbreviateNumber` utility converts a number to a shorter localized form.

name: anchorScroll
description:
The `anchorScroll` utility saves the scroll position relative to an element,
and then restores it after a callback has been run.

This is useful if a redraw will change the page's content above the viewport.
Normally doing this will result in the content in the viewport being pushed
down or pulled up. By wrapping the redraw with this utility, the scroll
position can be anchor to an element that is in or below the viewport, so
the content in the viewport will stay the same.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to anchor the scroll position to.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run that will change page content.

name: classList
description:
This util exposes `clsx` to core and extensions as a re-usable utility.

For full documentation, see `clsx` on GitHub.

name: computed
description:
The `computed` utility creates a function that will cache its output until
any of the dependent values are dirty.

params.name: dependentKeys
params.description: The keys of the dependent values.

params.name: compute
params.description:
The function which computes the value using the
    dependent values.

name: escapeRegExp
description: Escapes the `RegExp` special characters in `input`.

name: extract
description:
The `extract` utility deletes a property from an object and returns its
value.

name: extractText
description: Extract the text nodes from a virtual element.

name: formatNumber
description:
The `formatNumber` utility localizes a number into a string with the
appropriate punctuation.

name: humanTime
description:
The `humanTime` utility converts a date to a localized, human-readable time-
ago string.

name: liveHumanTimes
description:
The `liveHumanTimes` initializer sets up a loop every 1 second to update
timestamps rendered with the `humanTime` helper.

name: mapRoutes
description:
The `mapRoutes` utility converts a map of named application routes into a
format that can be understood by Mithril, and wraps them in route resolvers
to provide each route with the current route name.

name: mixin
description:
The `mixin` utility assigns the properties of a set of 'mixin' objects to
the prototype of a parent object.
examples: class MyClass extends mixin(ExistingClass, evented, etc) {}

params.name: Parent
params.description: The class to extend the new class from.

params.name: mixins
params.description: The objects to mix in.

return.description: A new class that extends Parent and contains the mixins.

name: setRouteWithForcedRefresh
description:
Mithril 2 does not completely rerender the page if a route change leads to the same route
(or the same component handling a different route). This util calls m.route.set, forcing a reonit.

name: truncate
description: Truncate a string to the given length, appending ellipses if necessary.

name: slug
description:
Create a slug out of the given string. Non-alphanumeric characters are
converted to hyphens.

NOTE: This method does not use the comparably sophisticated transliteration
mechanism that is employed in the backend. Therefore, it should only be used
to *suggest* slugs that can be overridden by the user.

name: getPlainContent
description:
Strip HTML tags and quotes out of the given string, replacing them with
meaningful punctuation.

name: ucfirst
description: Make a string's first character uppercase.

name: stringToColor
description: Convert the given string to a unique color.

name: subclassOf
description: Check if class A is the same as or a subclass of class B.

name: withAttr
description:
An event handler factory that makes it simpler to implement data binding
for component event listeners.

The handler created by this factory passes the DOM element's attribute
identified by the first argument to the callback (usually a bidirectional
Mithril stream: https://mithril.js.org/stream.html#bidirectional-bindings).

Replaces m.withAttr for Mithril 2.0.

name: notificationComponents
description: A map of notification types to their components.

name: postComponents
description: A map of post types to their components.

name: pane
description: An object which controls the state of the page's side pane.

name: drawer
description: An object which controls the state of the page's drawer.

name: history
description:
The app's history stack, which keeps track of which routes the user visits
so that they can easily navigate back to the previous route.

name: notifications
description: An object which controls the state of the user's notifications.

name: discussions
description:
An object which controls the state of the cached discussion list, which
is used in the index page and the slideout pane.

name: viewingDiscussion
description: Check whether or not the user is currently viewing a discussion.

name: authenticationComplete
description:
Callback for when an external authenticator (social login) action has
completed.

If the payload indicates that the user has been logged in, then the page
will be reloaded. Otherwise, a SignUpModal will be opened, prefilled
with the provided details.

params.name: payload
params.description:
A dictionary of attrs to pass into the sign up
    modal. A truthy `loggedIn` attr indicates that the user has logged
    in, and thus the page is reloaded.

name: AffixedSidebar
description:
The `AffixedSidebar` component uses Bootstrap's "affix" plugin to keep a
sidebar navigation at the top of the viewport when scrolling.

### Children

The component must wrap an element that itself wraps an <ul> element, which
will be "affixed".

name: AvatarEditor
description:
The `AvatarEditor` component displays a user's avatar along with a dropdown
menu which allows the user to upload/remove the avatar.

### Attrs

- `className`
- `user`

name: loading
description: Whether or not an avatar upload is in progress.

name: isDraggedOver
description: Whether or not an image has been dragged over the dropzone.

name: controlItems
description: Get the items in the edit avatar dropdown menu.

name: enableDragover
description: Enable dragover style

name: disableDragover
description: Disable dragover style

name: dropUpload
description: Upload avatar when file is dropped into dropzone.

name: quickUpload
description:
If the user doesn't have an avatar, there's no point in showing the
controls dropdown, because only one option would be viable: uploading.
Thus, when the avatar editor's dropdown toggle button is clicked, we prompt
the user to upload an avatar immediately.

name: openPicker
description: Upload avatar using file picker

name: upload
description: Upload avatar

name: remove
description: Remove the user's avatar.

name: success
description:
After a successful upload/removal, push the updated user data into the
store, and force a recomputation of the user's avatar color.

name: failure
description: If avatar upload/removal fails, stop loading.

name: ChangeEmailModal
description:
The `ChangeEmailModal` component shows a modal dialog which allows the user
to change their email address.

name: success
description: Whether or not the email has been changed successfully.

name: email
description: The value of the email input.

name: password
description: The value of the password input.

name: ChangePasswordModal
description:
The `ChangePasswordModal` component shows a modal dialog which allows the
user to send themself a password reset email.

name: CommentPost
description:
The `CommentPost` component displays a standard `comment`-typed post. This
includes a number of item lists (controls, header, and footer) surrounding
the post's HTML content.

### Attrs

- `post`

name: revealContent
description:
If the post has been hidden, then this flag determines whether or not its
content has been expanded.

name: cardVisible
description:
Whether or not the user hover card inside of PostUser is visible.
The property must be managed in CommentPost to be able to use it in the subtree check

name: toggleContent
description: Toggle the visibility of a hidden post's content.

name: headerItems
description: Build an item list for the post's header.

name: Composer
description:
The `Composer` component displays the composer. It can be loaded with a
content component with `load` and then its position/state can be altered with
`show`, `hide`, `close`, `minimize`, `fullScreen`, and `exitFullScreen`.

name: state
description: The composer's "state".

name: active
description: Whether or not the composer currently has focus.

name: configHandle
description:
Add the necessary event handlers to the composer's handle so that it can
be used to resize the composer.

name: onmousemove
description: Resize the composer according to mouse movement.

name: onmouseup
description: Finish resizing the composer when the mouse is released.

name: focus
description: Draw focus to the first focusable content element (the text editor).

name: updateHeight
description:
Update the DOM to reflect the composer's current height. This involves
setting the height of the composer's root element, and adjusting the height
of any flexible elements inside the composer's body.

name: updateBodyPadding
description:
Update the amount of padding-bottom on the body so that the page's
content will still be visible above the composer when the page is
scrolled right to the bottom.

name: animatePositionChange
description: Trigger the right animation depending on the desired new position.

name: animateHeightChange
description: Animate the Composer into the new position by changing the height.

name: showBackdrop
description: Show the Composer backdrop.

name: hideBackdrop
description: Hide the Composer backdrop.

name: show
description: Animate the composer sliding up from the bottom to take its normal height.

name: hide
description: Animate closing the composer.

name: minimize
description: Shrink the composer until only its title is visible.

name: controlItems
description: Build an item list for the composer's controls.

name: initializeHeight
description: Initialize default Composer height.

name: defaultHeight
description: Default height of the Composer in case none is saved.

name: changeHeight
description: Save a new Composer height and update the DOM.

name: ComposerBody
description:
The `ComposerBody` component handles the body, or the content, of the
composer. Subclasses should implement the `onsubmit` method and override
`headerTimes`.

### Attrs

- `composer`
- `originalContent`
- `submitLabel`
- `placeholder`
- `user`
- `confirmExit`
- `disabled`

name: loading
description: Whether or not the component is loading.

name: hasChanges
description: Check if there is any unsaved data.

name: headerItems
description: Build an item list for the composer's header.

name: onsubmit
description: Handle the submit event of the text editor.

name: loaded
description: Stop loading.

name: ComposerButton
description:
The `ComposerButton` component displays a button suitable for the composer
controls.

name: ComposerPostPreview
description:
The `ComposerPostPreview` component renders Markdown as HTML using the
TextFormatter library, polling a data source for changes every 50ms. This is
done to prevent expensive redraws on e.g. every single keystroke, while
still retaining the perception of live updates for the user.

### Attrs

- `composer` The state of the composer controlling this preview.
- `className` A CSS class for the element surrounding the preview.
- `surround` A callback that can execute code before and after re-render, e.g. for scroll anchoring.

name: DiscussionComposer
description:
The `DiscussionComposer` component displays the composer content for starting
a new discussion. It adds a text field as a header control so the user can
enter the title of their discussion. It also overrides the `submit` and
`willExit` actions to account for the title.

### Attrs

- All of the attrs for ComposerBody
- `titlePlaceholder`

name: title
description: The value of the title input.

name: onkeydown
description:
Handle the title input's keydown event. When the return key is pressed,
move the focus to the start of the text editor.

name: data
description: Get the data to submit to the server when the discussion is saved.

name: DiscussionHero
description:
The `DiscussionHero` component displays the hero on a discussion page.

### attrs

- `discussion`

name: items
description: Build an item list for the contents of the discussion hero.

name: DiscussionList
description:
The `DiscussionList` component displays a list of discussions.

### Attrs

- `state` A DiscussionListState object that represents the discussion lists's state.

name: DiscussionListItem
description:
The `DiscussionListItem` component shows a single discussion in the
discussion list.

### Attrs

- `discussion`
- `params`

name: subtree
description:
Set up a subtree retainer so that the discussion will not be redrawn
unless new data comes in.

name: active
description: Determine whether or not the discussion is currently being viewed.

name: showFirstPost
description:
Determine whether or not information about who started the discussion
should be displayed instead of information about the most recent reply to
the discussion.

name: showRepliesCount
description:
Determine whether or not the number of replies should be shown instead of
the number of unread posts.

name: markAsRead
description: Mark the discussion as read.

name: infoItems
description:
Build an item list of info for a discussion listing. By default this is
just the first/last post indicator.

name: DiscussionListPane
description:
The `DiscussionListPane` component displays the list of previously viewed
discussions in a panel that can be displayed by moving the mouse to the left
edge of the screen, where it can also be pinned in place.

### Attrs

- `state` A DiscussionListState object that represents the discussion lists's state.

name: enoughSpace
description: Are we on a device that's larger than we consider "mobile"?

name: DiscussionPage
description:
The `DiscussionPage` component displays a whole discussion page, including
the discussion list pane, the hero, the posts, and the sidebar.

name: discussion
description: The discussion that is being viewed.

name: near
description: The number of the first post that is currently visible in the viewport.

name: load
description: Load the discussion from the API or use the preloaded one.

name: requestParams
description:
Get the parameters that should be passed in the API request to get the
discussion.

name: show
description: Initialize the component to display the given discussion.

name: sidebarItems
description: Build an item list for the contents of the sidebar.

name: positionChanged
description:
When the posts that are visible in the post stream change (i.e. the user
scrolls up or down), then we update the URL and mark the posts as read.

name: DiscussionRenamedNotification
description:
The `DiscussionRenamedNotification` component displays a notification which
indicates that a discussion has had its title changed.

### Attrs

- All of the attrs for Notification

name: DiscussionRenamedPost
description:
The `DiscussionRenamedPost` component displays a discussion event post
indicating that the discussion has been renamed.

### Attrs

- All of the attrs for EventPost

name: DiscussionsUserPage
description:
The `DiscussionsUserPage` component shows a discussion list inside of a user
page.

name: EditPostComposer
description:
The `EditPostComposer` component displays the composer content for editing a
post. It sets the initial content to the content of the post that is being
edited, and adds a header control to indicate which post is being edited.

### Attrs

- All of the attrs for ComposerBody
- `post`

name: jumpToPreview
description: Jump to the preview when triggered by the text editor.

name: data
description: Get the data to submit to the server when the post is saved.

name: EventPost
description:
The `EventPost` component displays a post which indicating a discussion
event, like a discussion being renamed or stickied. Subclasses must implement
the `icon` and `description` methods.

### Attrs

- All of the attrs for `Post`

name: icon
description: Get the name of the event icon.

name: description
description: Get the description text for the event.

return.description: The description to render in the DOM

name: descriptionKey
description: Get the translation key for the description of the event.

name: descriptionData
description: Get the translation data for the description of the event.

name: ForgotPasswordModal
description:
The `ForgotPasswordModal` component displays a modal which allows the user to
enter their email address and request a link to reset their password.

### Attrs

- `email`

name: email
description: The value of the email input.

name: success
description: Whether or not the password reset email was sent successfully.

name: HeaderPrimary
description:
The `HeaderPrimary` component displays primary header controls. On the
default skin, these are shown just to the right of the forum title.

name: items
description: Build an item list for the controls.

name: HeaderSecondary
description:
The `HeaderSecondary` component displays secondary header controls, such as
the search box and the user menu. On the default skin, these are shown on the
right side of the header.

name: items
description: Build an item list for the controls.

name: IndexPage
description:
The `IndexPage` component displays the index page, including the welcome
hero, the sidebar, and the discussion list.

name: hero
description: Get the component to display as the hero.

name: sidebarItems
description:
Build an item list for the sidebar of the index page. By default this is a
"New Discussion" button, and then a DropdownSelect component containing a
list of navigation items.

name: navItems
description:
Build an item list for the navigation in the sidebar of the index page. By
default this is just the 'All Discussions' link.

name: viewItems
description:
Build an item list for the part of the toolbar which is concerned with how
the results are displayed. By default this is just a select box to change
the way discussions are sorted.

name: actionItems
description:
Build an item list for the part of the toolbar which is about taking action
on the results. By default this is just a "mark all as read" button.

name: newDiscussionAction
description: Open the composer for a new discussion or prompt the user to login.

name: markAllAsRead
description: Mark all discussions as read.

name: LoadingPost
description:
The `LoadingPost` component shows a placeholder that looks like a post,
indicating that the post is loading.

name: LogInButton
description:
The `LogInButton` component displays a social login button which will open
a popup window containing the specified path.

### Attrs

- `path`

name: LogInButtons
description: The `LogInButtons` component displays a collection of social login buttons.

name: items
description: Build a list of LogInButton components.

name: LogInModal
description:
The `LogInModal` component displays a modal dialog with a login form.

### Attrs

- `identification`
- `password`

name: identification
description: The value of the identification input.

name: password
description: The value of the password input.

name: remember
description: The value of the remember me input.

name: forgotPassword
description:
Open the forgot password modal, prefilling it with an email if the user has
entered one.

name: signUp
description:
Open the sign up modal, prefilling it with an email/username/password if
the user has entered one.

name: Notification
description:
The `Notification` component abstract displays a single notification.
Subclasses should implement the `icon`, `href`, and `content` methods.

### Attrs

- `notification`

name: icon
description: Get the name of the icon that should be displayed in the notification.

name: href
description: Get the URL that the notification should link to.

name: content
description: Get the content of the notification.

name: excerpt
description: Get the excerpt of the notification.

name: markAsRead
description: Mark the notification as read.

name: NotificationGrid
description:
The `NotificationGrid` component displays a table of notification types and
methods, allowing the user to toggle each combination.

### Attrs

- `user`

name: methods
description: Information about the available notification methods.

name: loading
description: A map of which notification checkboxes are loading.

name: types
description: Information about the available notification types.

name: toggle
description:
Toggle the state of the given preferences, based on the value of the first
one.

name: toggleMethod
description: Toggle all notification types for the given method.

name: toggleType
description: Toggle all notification methods for the given type.

name: preferenceKey
description:
Get the name of the preference key for the given notification type-method
combination.

name: notificationMethods
description:
Build an item list for the notification methods to display in the grid.

Each notification method is an object which has the following properties:

- `name` The name of the notification method.
- `icon` The icon to display in the column header.
- `label` The label to display in the column header.

name: notificationTypes
description:
Build an item list for the notification types to display in the grid.

Each notification type is an object which has the following properties:

- `name` The name of the notification type.
- `icon` The icon to display in the notification grid row.
- `label` The label to display in the notification grid row.

name: NotificationList
description:
The `NotificationList` component displays a list of the logged-in user's
notifications, grouped by discussion.

name: inPanel
description:
If the NotificationList component isn't in a panel (e.g. on NotificationPage when mobile),
we need to listen to scroll events on the window, and get scroll state from the body.

name: NotificationsPage
description:
The `NotificationsPage` component shows the notifications list. It is only
used on mobile devices where the notifications dropdown is within the drawer.

name: Post
description:
The `Post` component displays a single post. The basic post template just
includes a controls dropdown; subclasses must implement `content` and `attrs`
methods.

### Attrs

- `post`

name: subtree
description:
Set up a subtree retainer so that the post will not be redrawn
unless new data comes in.

name: elementAttrs
description: Get attributes for the post element.

name: content
description: Get the post's content.

name: classes
description: Get the post's classes.

params.name: string
params.description: classes

name: actionItems
description: Build an item list for the post's actions.

name: footerItems
description: Build an item list for the post's footer.

name: PostEdited
description:
The `PostEdited` component displays information about when and by whom a post
was edited.

### Attrs

- `post`

name: PostMeta
description:
The `PostMeta` component displays the time of a post, and when clicked, shows
a dropdown containing more information about the post (number, full time,
permalink).

### Attrs

- `post`

name: getPermalink
description: Get the permalink for the given post.

name: PostPreview
description:
The `PostPreview` component shows a link to a post containing the avatar and
username of the author, and a short excerpt of the post's content.

### Attrs

- `post`

name: PostStream
description:
The `PostStream` component displays an infinitely-scrollable wall of posts in
a discussion. Posts that have not loaded will be displayed as placeholders.

### Attrs

- `discussion`
- `stream`
- `targetPost`
- `onPositionChange`

name: triggerScroll
description: Start scrolling, if appropriate, to a newly-targeted post.

name: loadPostsIfNeeded
description:
Check if either extreme of the post stream is in the viewport,
and if so, trigger loading the next/previous page.

name: calculatePosition
description:
Work out which posts (by number) are currently visible in the viewport, and
fire an event with the information.

name: getMarginTop
description:
Get the distance from the top of the viewport to the point at which we
would consider a post to be the first one visible.

name: scrollToNumber
description: Scroll down to a certain post by number and 'flash' it.

name: scrollToIndex
description: Scroll down to a certain post by index.

params.name: reply
params.description: Whether or not to scroll to the reply placeholder.

name: scrollToItem
description: Scroll down to the given post.

params.name: force
params.description:
Whether or not to force scrolling to the item, even
    if it is already in the viewport.

params.name: reply
params.description: Whether or not to scroll to the reply placeholder.

name: flashItem
description: 'Flash' the given post, drawing the user's attention to it.

name: PostStreamScrubber
description:
The `PostStreamScrubber` component displays a scrubber which can be used to
navigate/scrub through a post stream.

### Attrs

- `stream`
- `className`

name: updateScrubberValues
description:
Update the scrollbar's position to reflect the current values of the
index/visible properties.

name: goToFirst
description: Go to the first post in the discussion.

name: goToLast
description: Go to the last post in the discussion.

name: percentPerPost
description:
Get the percentage of the height of the scrubber that should be allocated
to each post.

properties.name: index
properties.description:
The percent per post for posts on either side of
    the visible part of the scrubber.

properties.name: visible
properties.description:
The percent per post for the visible part of the
    scrubber.

name: PostUser
description:
The `PostUser` component shows the avatar and username of a post's author.

### Attrs

- `post`

name: showCard
description: Show the user card.

name: hideCard
description: Hide the user card.

name: PostsUserPage
description:
The `PostsUserPage` component shows a user's activity feed inside of their
profile.

name: loading
description: Whether or not the activity feed is currently loading.

name: moreResults
description: Whether or not there are any more activity items that can be loaded.

name: posts
description: The Post models in the feed.

name: loadLimit
description: The number of activity items to load per request.

name: show
description:
Initialize the component with a user, and trigger the loading of their
activity feed.

name: refresh
description: Clear and reload the user's activity feed.

name: loadResults
description: Load a new page of the user's activity feed.

params.name: offset
params.description: The position to start getting results from.

name: loadMore
description: Load the next page of results.

name: parseResults
description: Parse results and append them to the activity feed.

name: RenameDiscussionModal
description: The 'RenameDiscussionModal' displays a modal dialog with an input to rename a discussion

name: ReplyComposer
description:
The `ReplyComposer` component displays the composer content for replying to a
discussion.

### Attrs

- All of the attrs of ComposerBody
- `discussion`

name: jumpToPreview
description: Jump to the preview when triggered by the text editor.

name: data
description: Get the data to submit to the server when the reply is saved.

name: ReplyPlaceholder
description:
The `ReplyPlaceholder` component displays a placeholder for a reply, which,
when clicked, opens the reply composer.

### Attrs

- `discussion`

name: SessionDropdown
description:
The `SessionDropdown` component shows a button with the current user's
avatar/name, with a dropdown of session controls.

name: items
description: Build an item list for the contents of the dropdown menu.

name: SettingsPage
description:
The `SettingsPage` component displays the user's settings control panel, in
the context of their user profile.

name: settingsItems
description: Build an item list for the user's settings controls.

name: accountItems
description: Build an item list for the user's account settings.

name: notificationsItems
description: Build an item list for the user's notification settings.

name: privacyItems
description: Build an item list for the user's privacy settings.

name: SignUpModal
description:
The `SignUpModal` component displays a modal dialog with a singup form.

### Attrs

- `username`
- `email`
- `password`
- `token` An email token to sign up with.

name: username
description: The value of the username input.

name: email
description: The value of the email input.

name: password
description: The value of the password input.

name: logIn
description:
Open the log in modal, prefilling it with an email/username/password if
the user has entered one.

name: submitData
description: Get the data that should be submitted in the sign-up request.

name: TerminalPost
description:
Displays information about a the first or last post in a discussion.

### Attrs

- `discussion`
- `lastPost`

name: UserCard
description:
The `UserCard` component displays a user's profile card. This is used both on
the `UserPage` (in the hero) and in discussions, shown when hovering over a
post author.

### Attrs

- `user`
- `className`
- `editable`
- `controlsButtonClassName`

name: infoItems
description: Build an item list of tidbits of info to show on this user's profile.

name: UserPage
description:
The `UserPage` component shows a user's profile. It can be extended to show
content inside of the content area. See `ActivityPage` and `SettingsPage` for
examples.

name: user
description: The user this page is for.

name: content
description: Get the content to display in the user page.

name: show
description:
Initialize the component with a user, and trigger the loading of their
activity feed.

name: loadUser
description:
Given a username, load the user's profile from the store, or make a request
if we don't have it yet. Then initialize the profile page with that user.

name: sidebarItems
description: Build an item list for the content of the sidebar.

name: navItems
description: Build an item list for the navigation in the sidebar.

name: WelcomeHero
description:
The `WelcomeHero` component displays a hero that welcomes the user to the
forum.

name: hide
description: Hide the welcome hero.

name: DiscussionPageResolver
description:
A custom route resolver for DiscussionPage that generates the same key to all posts
on the same discussion. It triggers a scroll when going from one post to another
in the same discussion.

name: canonicalizeDiscussionSlug
description:
Remove optional parts of a discussion's slug to keep the substring
that bijectively maps to a discussion object. By default this just
extracts the numerical ID from the slug. If a custom discussion
slugging driver is used, this may need to be overriden.

name: routes
description: The `routes` initializer defines the forum app's routes.

name: position
description: The composer's current position.

name: height
description:
The composer's intended height, which can be modified by the user
(by dragging the composer handle).

name: body
description: The dynamic component being shown inside the composer.

name: editor
description: A reference to the text editor that allows text manipulation.

name: load
description: Load a content component into the composer.

name: clear
description: Clear the composer's content component.

name: show
description: Show the composer.

name: hide
description: Close the composer.

name: close
description:
Confirm with the user so they don't lose their content, then close the
composer.

name: minimize
description: Minimize the composer. Has no effect if the composer is hidden.

name: fullScreen
description:
Take the composer into fullscreen mode. Has no effect if the composer is
hidden.

name: exitFullScreen
description: Exit fullscreen mode.

name: bodyMatches
description: Determine whether the body matches the given component class and data.

params.name: type
params.description:
The component class to check against. Subclasses are
                     accepted as well.

name: isVisible
description:
Determine whether or not the Composer is visible.

True when the composer is displayed on the screen and has a body component.
It could be open in "normal" or full-screen mode, or even minimized.

name: isFullScreen
description:
Determine whether or not the Composer is covering the screen.

This will be true if the Composer is in full-screen mode on desktop,
or if we are on a mobile device, where we always consider the composer as full-screen..

name: composingReplyTo
description:
Check whether or not the user is currently composing a reply to a
discussion.

name: preventExit
description:
Confirm with the user that they want to close the composer and lose their
content.

return.description: Whether or not the exit was cancelled.

name: preventClosingWhen
description:
Configure when / what to ask the user before closing the composer.

The provided callback will be used to determine whether asking for
confirmation is necessary. If the callback returns true at the time of
closing, the provided text will be shown in a standard confirmation dialog.

name: minimumHeight
description: Minimum height of the Composer.

name: maximumHeight
description: Maxmimum height of the Composer.

name: computedHeight
description:
Computed the composer's current height, based on the intended height, and
the composer's current state. This will be applied to the composer's
content's DOM element.

name: sortMap
description:
Get a map of sort keys (which appear in the URL, and are used for
translation) to the API sort value that they represent.

name: isSearchResults
description: In the last request, has the user searched for a discussion?

name: addDiscussion
description: Add a discussion to the top of the list.

name: clear
description: Clear the search input and the current controller's active search.

name: clearInitialSearch
description:
Redirect to the index page without a search filter. This is called when the
'x' is clicked in the search box in the header.

name: stickyParams
description:
Get URL parameters that stick between filter changes.

This can be used to generate a link that clears filters.

name: params
description: Get parameters to be used in the current page.

name: changeSort
description: Redirect to the index page using the given sort parameter.

name: load
description: Load the next page of notification results.

name: markAllAsRead
description: Mark all of the notifications as read.

name: discussion
description: The discussion to display the post stream for.

name: paused
description:
Whether or not the infinite-scrolling auto-load functionality is
disabled.

name: visible
description: The number of posts that are currently visible in the viewport.

name: description
description: The description to render on the scrubber.

name: forceUpdateScrubber
description:
When the page is scrolled, goToIndex is called, or the page is loaded,
various listeners result in the scrubber being updated with a new
position and values. However, if goToNumber is called, the scrubber
will not be updated. Accordingly, we add logic to the scrubber's
onupdate to update itself, but only when needed, as indicated by this
property.

name: update
description:
Update the stream so that it loads and includes the latest posts in the
discussion, if the end is being viewed.

name: goToFirst
description: Load and scroll up to the first post in the discussion.

name: goToLast
description: Load and scroll down to the last post in the discussion.

name: goToNumber
description: Load and scroll to a post with a certain number.

params.name: number
params.description:
The post number to go to. If 'reply', go to
    the last post and scroll the reply preview into view.

name: goToIndex
description: Load and scroll to a certain index within the discussion.

name: loadNearNumber
description:
Clear the stream and load posts near a certain number. Returns a promise.
If the post with the given number is already loaded, the promise will be
resolved immediately.

name: loadNearIndex
description:
Clear the stream and load posts near a certain index. A page of posts
surrounding the given index will be loaded. Returns a promise. If the given
index is already loaded, the promise will be resolved immediately.

name: _loadNext
description: Load the next page of posts.

name: _loadPrevious
description: Load the previous page of posts.

name: loadPage
description: Load a page of posts into the stream and redraw.

name: loadRange
description:
Load and inject the specified range of posts into the stream, without
clearing it.

name: show
description: Set up the stream with the given array of posts.

name: reset
description:
Reset the stream so that a specific range of posts is displayed. If a range
is not specified, the first page of posts will be displayed.

name: posts
description: Get the visible page of posts.

name: count
description: Get the total number of posts in the discussion.

name: disabled
description:
Check whether or not the scrubber should be disabled, i.e. if all of the
posts are visible in the viewport.

name: viewingEnd
description: Are we currently viewing the end of the discussion?

name: sanitizeIndex
description:
Make sure that the given index is not outside of the possible range of
indexes in the discussion.

name: getInitialSearch
description:
If we are displaying the full results of a search (not just a preview),
this value should return the query that prompted that search.

In this generic class, full page searching is not supported.
This method should be implemented by subclasses that do support it.

name: clear
description: Clear the search value.

name: cache
description:
Mark that we have already searched for this query so that we don't
have to ping the endpoint again.

name: isCached
description: Check if this query has been searched before.

name: History
description:
The `History` class keeps track and manages a stack of routes that the user
has navigated to in their session.

An item can be pushed to the top of the stack using the `push` method. An
item in the stack has a name and a URL. The name need not be unique; if it is
the same as the item before it, that will be overwritten with the new URL. In
this way, if a user visits a discussion, and then visits another discussion,
popping the history stack will still take them back to the discussion list
rather than the previous discussion.

name: stack
description: The stack of routes that have been navigated to.

name: getCurrent
description: Get the item on the top of the stack.

name: getPrevious
description: Get the previous item on the stack.

name: push
description: Push an item to the top of the stack.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the route.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the route.

params.name: url
params.description:
The URL of the route. The current URL will be used if
    not provided.

name: canGoBack
description: Check whether or not the history stack is able to be popped.

name: back
description: Go back to the previous route in the history stack.

name: backUrl
description: Get the URL of the previous page.

name: home
description: Go to the first route in the history stack.

name: KeyboardNavigatable
description:
The `KeyboardNavigatable` class manages lists that can be navigated with the
keyboard, calling callbacks for each actions.

This helper encapsulates the key binding logic, providing a simple fluent
API for use.

name: callbacks
description: Callback to be executed for a specified input.

name: whenCallback
description:
Callback that determines whether keyboard input should be handled.
By default, always handle keyboard navigation.

name: onUp
description:
Provide a callback to be executed when navigating upwards.

This will be triggered by the Up key.

name: onDown
description:
Provide a callback to be executed when navigating downwards.

This will be triggered by the Down key.

name: onSelect
description:
Provide a callback to be executed when the current item is selected..

This will be triggered by the Return and Tab keys..

name: onCancel
description:
Provide a callback to be executed when the navigation is canceled.

This will be triggered by the Escape key.

name: onRemove
description:
Provide a callback to be executed when previous input is removed.

This will be triggered by the Backspace key.

name: when
description: Provide a callback that determines whether keyboard input should be handled.

name: bindTo
description: Set up the navigation key bindings on the given jQuery element.

name: navigate
description: Interpret the given keyboard event as navigation commands.

name: Pane
description:
The `Pane` class manages the page's discussion list sidepane. The pane is a
part of the content view (DiscussionPage component), but its visibility is
determined by CSS classes applied to the outer page element. This class
manages the application of those CSS classes.

name: pinnedKey
description: The localStorage key to store the pane's pinned state with.

name: $element
description: The page element.

name: pinned
description: Whether or not the pane is currently pinned.

name: active
description: Whether or not the pane is currently exists.

name: showing
description:
Whether or not the pane is currently showing, or is hidden off the edge
of the screen.

name: enable
description: Enable the pane.

name: disable
description: Disable the pane.

name: show
description: Show the pane.

name: hide
description: Hide the pane.

name: onmouseleave
description:
Begin a timeout to hide the pane, which can be cancelled by showing the
pane.

name: togglePinned
description: Toggle whether or not the pane is pinned.

name: render
description: Apply the appropriate CSS classes to the page element.

name: alertEmailConfirmation
description: Shows an alert if the user has not yet confirmed their email address.

name: slidable
description:
The `slidable` utility adds touch gestures to an element so that it can be
slid away to reveal controls underneath, and then released to activate those
controls.

It relies on the element having children with particular CSS classes.
TODO: document

properties.name: reset
properties.description:
Revert the slider to its original position. This
    should be called, for example, when a controls dropdown is closed.

content:
# Flarum JS API Docs

[Flarum](https://github.com/flarum/core)'s JS API Docs serve the purpose to help contributors contribute to Flarum, and extension developers to extend it as well.

## Contributing

Interested in contributing to Flarum? Please read the [Contributing docs](https://flarum.org/docs/contributing.html) to learn how you can help.
name: ./README.md
